description: Borrowed from Ancient Greek ἆσθμα (âsthma, “laborious breathing, asthma”). Displaced native Old English angbrēost (literally “tight chest”).

nouns.description: asthma (usually uncountable, plural asthmas or asthmata)

entries.meaning: (pathology) A long-term respiratory condition, in which the airways may unexpectedly and suddenly narrow, often in response to an allergen, cold air, exercise, or emotional stress. Symptoms include wheezing, shortness of breath, chest tightness, and coughing.
